item.name: {$NAME} System description
item.description: A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software.

item.name: {$NAME} System Name
item.description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string

item_prototype.name: {$NAME} {#SNMPVALUE} status
item_prototype.description: "The operational state of the fan or fan tray. unknown(1) - unknown. up(2) - powered on. down(3) - powered down. warning(4) - partial failure, needs replacement as soon as possible."

discovery_rule.name: CPU Total load
discovery_rule.description: The entPhysicalIndex of the physical entity for which the CPU statistics in this entry are maintained. The physical entity can be a CPU chip, a group of CPUs, a CPU card etc. The exact type of this entity is described by its entPhysicalVendorType value. If the CPU statistics in this entry correspond to more than one physical entity (or to no physical entity), or if the entPhysicalTable is not supported on the SNMP agent, the value of this object must be zero.

item_prototype.name: {$NAME} CPU Memory free
item_prototype.description: The overall CPU wide system memory which is currently free

item_prototype.name: {$NAME} CPU Memory used
item_prototype.description: The overall CPU wide system memory which is currently under use.

item_prototype.name: {$NAME} CPU Total pourcentage (1min)
item_prototype.description: The overall CPU busy percentage in the last 1 minute period. This object deprecates the object cpmCPUTotal1min and increases the value range to (0..100).

trigger.name: {$NAME} : Switch ne répond plus en SNMP
